intro: Lessertia flexuosa var. rigida, commonly known as the rigid lessertia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense, velvety foliage. The plant produces clusters of showy, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, which attract pollinators such as birds and insects. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its compact size and vibrant blooms make it a valuable addition to both garden landscapes and container plantings.
